page.title: 05LITTLE CRAPNELL FARM.
page.content: {Mr.& Mrs. Speed}rent{96 acres}on the southern side of the Mendips at 190 metres O.D. The{dairy farm}is part of the Somerville estates at Dinder and this is the second generation of Speeds at the farm. There are 120 milkers with 20 followers and the{milk {is sold to the Milk Marketing Board at {Frome;}barren cows go to{market at {Winsford}and{veal calves}are sold at 16_18 weeks to Volac of Dorchester and Pylle. 14 sows and 1 boar are kept and {the piglets are raised to pork}and sold to Jarrets of Oldland Common nr. Bristol. There are 20 hens. Most of the farm is{grass,}but about{10 acres are used for{fodder beet and stubble {turnips. }Large bale{silage}and some {hay}are the other fodder crops. E.E.C. milk quotas mean that supplimentary feed is not given in May and June. The farm is a{Caravan Club site (May-Sept)
